medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe nasal airway problems due to a previous septal operation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been experiencing nasal airway issues that worsened over time, particularly after the removal of the entire cartilaginous septum in a prior surgery in 1983. Treatment with colchicine began in 1992, with additional steroids introduced after exacerbation in 1993. After a remission period, surgery was planned due to persistent airway problems.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of Behçet disease, with manifestations including oral and genital aphthous lesions, arthritis, and skin lesions. This condition has been under control, with a significant surgical history related to it.
medical_history.family_history: Two sisters of the patient also have been treated for Behçet disease.
